content:
Diagnosis
	1. High grade serous carcinoma of ovary
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin AUC5 and Paclitaxel 175mg/m2 3-weekly - completed 3 cycles
	2. Maintenance Niraparib 200mg daily commenced 15 March 2024

	Clinical studies
	NIRAVO-OV22 trial screening in progress

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on CT 12 April 2024

	Current issues
	Grade 2 thrombocytopenia, Grade 1 fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at Gynae-oncology MDT today. 54-year-old lady with stage IIIC high grade serous ovarian cancer, BRCA1 VUS detected, HRD positive. Completed 3 cycles carboplatin/paclitaxel with partial response. Started maintenance Niraparib in March 2024.

Latest CT shows stable disease with reduction in peritoneal disease compared to baseline. CA125 has decreased from 450 to 125. Currently experiencing grade 2 thrombocytopenia (platelets 75) and grade 1 fatigue on Niraparib.

MDT recommendations:
1. Continue Niraparib at current dose with weekly platelet monitoring
2. Proceed with NIRAVO-OV22 trial screening if platelets recover to >100
3. Repeat CT in 3 months

	Further investigations
	Weekly FBC
Repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months

	Medication prescribed
	Niraparib 200mg daily to continue

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks with blood results

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC monitoring
Please inform team if platelets <75

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows stable disease with reduction in peritoneal disease compared to baseline

status_updates.value: Stage IIIC ovarian cancer showing partial response to initial chemotherapy. Now on maintenance Niraparib with stable disease but experiencing grade 2 thrombocytopenia
Grade 2 thrombocytopenia and grade 1 fatigue on Niraparib
Continue Niraparib 200mg daily with weekly platelet monitoring
Weekly FBC monitoring and CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months
Oncology review in 2 weeks with blood results
